intro: Alyssoides gemonensis, commonly known as the Gemonian alissoid, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Italy. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
